The Battle Gets Ugly! Apurva Asrani Calls Kangana 'Insecure' And Adds That Her Game Is Brutal
The Battle Gets Ugly! Apurva Asrani Calls Kangana 'Insecure' And Adds That Her Game Is Brutal
Kangana Ranaut's Manikarnika might be winning at the box-office but the controversy surrounding the film and Kangana is nowhere close to dead-end.
In an interaction with Spotboye, Krish, the co-director of Manikarnika had said, “I don’t think how Kangana can sleep well by taking the first credit in direction when she does not deserve it”.
Co-director Krish pointed out that it was Kangana who made him quit the film abruptly, now Queen writer Apurva Asrani too has come forward in his support. He added that Kangana had "hijacked" Simran too.
